  • Gathering Latest EV News Article Data
    • Data source: News API
  • Carry out some preliminary shaping of the data into a dataframe
  • Resources

Gathering Latest EV News Article Data

This documents the process of collecting textual data on electric vehicles from news articles. The news API offers the latest news on specific topics, enabling us to gather crucial information for a thorough analysis of public perception and media portrayals of EVs. Such information could be invaluable for companies while making key business decisions.

The raw data returned from the News API is in a json format. This needs to undergo some data cleaning processes before being used for analysis. Below we can see an excerpt of the raw json format of the data that is returned and after some cleaning, the dataframe that is formed.

Data source: News API

Show the code 
import requests
import json

# Base URL for the API endpoint
url = 'https://newsapi.org/v2/everything'

# Set all query parameters in a dictionary
params = {
    'q': 'electric-vehicles',  # Updated query
    'from': '2023-11-04',      # Starting date
    'sortBy': 'publishedAt',   # Sorting criterion
    'apiKey': '481b1e4a75874d2f9a23e3329031364c'  
}

# Make the GET request with the URL and parameters
response = requests.get(url, params=params)

# Convert the response to JSON format
json_data = response.json()

# Print the JSON response
print(json_data)

# Save the results in a JSON file
with open('electric_vehicles_news_data.json', 'w') as json_file:
    json.dump(json_data, json_file, indent=4)

print("Data saved in electric_vehicles_news_data.json")

Data saved in electric_vehicles_news_data.json

Carry out some preliminary shaping of the data into a dataframe

Show the code 
import pandas as pd
import json

# Read the JSON file
file_path = 'electric_vehicles_news_data.json'
with open(file_path, 'r') as file:
    json_data = json.load(file)

# Extracting articles from the JSON data
# the articles are nested under a key "articles"
articles = json_data['articles'] if 'articles' in json_data else json_data

# Extracting data from each article
df_list = []
for article in articles:
    if isinstance(article, dict):
        row = {
            'source': article['source']['name'] if 'source' in article and 'name' in article['source'] else None,
            'author': article.get('author'),
            'title': article.get('title'),
            'description': article.get('description'),
            'url': article.get('url'),
            'urlToImage': article.get('urlToImage'),
            'publishedAt': article.get('publishedAt'),
            'content': article.get('content')
        }
        df_list.append(row)

# Converting the list of dictionaries to a DataFrame
df = pd.DataFrame(df_list)

# Display the first few rows of the DataFrame
print(df.head())

Show the code 
import pandas as pd

# Extracting the 'description' column and joining all rows into one string
joined_description = ' '.join(df['description'].dropna())

# Saving the joined description to a text file
with open('description.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as file:
    file.write(joined_description)

print("The descriptions have been successfully joined and saved to 'description.txt'")
The descriptions have been successfully joined and saved to 'description.txt'
